wikipedia_page.main: Mary Edith Nepean née Bellis (1876–1960) was a Welsh writer who wrote in English. Her 35 romantic novels mainly have Welsh settings or characters. Nepean was trained as a painter by Robert Fowler, and her paintings were demonstrated in exhibitions. She was a commandant of the Red Cross.

response: *Mary Edith Nepean – Gwyneth of the Welsh Hills
